list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Pick the one you like best.

list_definition.definition: to take (flowers from a plant, fruit from a tree etc), usually by hand

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The little girl sat on the grass and picked flowers.

list_definition.definition: to unlock (a lock) with a tool other than a key

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The thief must have picked the lock with a hair-pin.

list_definition.definition: whatever or whichever a person wants or chooses

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Take your pick of these prizes.

list_definition.definition: the best one(s) from or the best part of something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: These grapes are the pick of the bunch.

list_definition.definition: (also British pickaxe, American pickax – plural pickaxes) a tool with a heavy metal head pointed at one or both ends, used for breaking hard surfaces eg walls, roads, rocks etc.
